moves.14... Nd6 15. f4: I felt unsure about a direct Rxe5+: unjustified, but I had a plan...
moves.19... Qxg3 20. hxg3 Ng6: now, White has to make a plan: Bxg6 only equalizes...
moves.23. Bb3: create a hidden check over e6...
moves.23... Rad8 24. Rac1 c6 25. a4: White needs to compromise Blacks' Queens' wing...
moves.25... Rd2 26. Rc2 Rff2: this attack, can - of course - never work...
moves.27... Rxd2 28. Rf1: new territory for a White attack...
moves.28... Rxb2 29. Rf7: a diabolical dilemma: after moving the Knight, just Rxb7...
moves.31... Kf8 32. Rxb7 Rxe6 33. Rxa7: Blacks' problem is clear: his King is confined to the bottom row...
moves.36. Kd4 Ke6: after 35. ... Ke7, Black would have Kd7: this lost tempo will lose the game...
moves.38. Rxc6+ Rxc6+ 39. Kxc6: Black has woken up: he resigned...

gameName: Fierce Queen playing a random chess game...
